titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Erwin Edelman Typescript: The Suppressed Facts of the Rosenberg Case TAM.199
titlestmt.author: Tamiment staff, 2009

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-03 11:42:36 -0400.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Erwin Edelman Typescript: The Suppressed Facts of the Rosenberg Case

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This manuscript was separated from the Earl and Sylvia Price Papers (TAM 175). The materials were found in repository and most likely donated by Syliva Price in 1994. The accession number associated with this collection is 1994.002.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Erwin Edelman (b. 1928?) was a progressive activist, possibly a one-time member of the Communist Party USA, and the author of the unpublished typescript "The Suppressed Facts of the Rosenberg Case."

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Erwin Edelman Typescript: The Suppressed Facts of the Rosenberg Case; TAM 199; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This manuscript was separated from the Earl and Sylvia Price Papers (TAM 175).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a 142 page undated typescript, "The Suppressed Facts of the Rosenberg Case," by Erwin Edelman. This critique of the United States government's case against Julius and Ethel Rosenberg, who were convicted in 1951, then executed in 1953, for allegedly conspiring to commit espionage to give information to the Soviet Union on the construction of U.S. atomic bombs, focuses on the problematic notion of the existence of an "atomic bomb secret."

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by Erwin Edelman was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
